trans-unit.source: Represents a security token handler that processes tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
By default, the handler will perform chain-trust validation of the X.509 certificate.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler"></xref> class with default values.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.MapToWindows%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator.PeerOrChainTrust%2A> validator is used as the default certificate validator.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler"></xref> class by using a value that indicates whether the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator.PeerOrChainTrust%2A> validator is used as the default certificate validator.
`true` if the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.MapToWindows"></xref> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler"></xref> class by using the specified certificate validator.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.MapToWindows%2A> property is set to `false`.
The certificate validator to use.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.CertificateValidator"></xref> property.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler"></xref> class by using a value that indicates whether the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account and the specified certificate validator.
`true` if the certificate should be mapped to a Windows account; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.MapToWindows"></xref> property.
The certificate validator to use.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.CertificateValidator"></xref> property.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified reader is referring to an `<ds:X509Data>` element.
An XML reader positioned at the start element of the key identifier clause.
`true` if the reader is referring to an `<ds:X509Data>` element; otherwise, `false`.
reader is `null`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the reader points to an X.509 security token as defined in the WS-Security specification.
A reader pointing to the token XML.
`true` if the reader is pointing to an X.509 security token; otherwise, `false`.
reader is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this handler supports validation of tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
`true` if the handler supports validation of tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Always `true`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified key identifier clause can be serialized by this handler.
The supported key identifier clause types are:
The key identifier clause to be serialized.
`true` if the securityKeyIdentifierClause is supported and if the property is set to `true`; otherwise, `false`.
securityKeyIdentifierClause is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this handler can write tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
`true` if the handler can write tokens of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Always `true`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator"></xref> that is used by the current instance.
The X.509 certificate validator that is used by the current instance.
Gets the X.509 security token type defined in the WS-Security X.509 Token Profile.
The X.509 token type URI.
By default, the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenTypes.X509Certificate"></xref> property.
Loads custom configuration from XML.
The XML elements that contain the custom configuration.
customConfigElements is `null`.
The custom configuration specified is not valid.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the validating token should be mapped to a Windows account.
`true` if the validating token should be mapped to a Windows account; otherwise, `false`.
Deserializes a key identifier clause referenced by the specified XML reader.
The XML reader referencing the key identifier clause.
The key identifier clause that was deserialized from the XML.
reader is `null`.
Deserializes the X.509 security token referenced by the specified XML reader.
An XML reader that is pointing to an X.509 security token.
The security token deserialized from the XML.
An instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
reader is `null`.
reader is not pointing to a valid X.509 security token as defined in the WS-Security X.509 Token Profile.
Or the encodingType specified is other than Base64 or HexBinary.
Gets the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the tokens that this handler processes.
By default, the type of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref> class.
Validates the specified X.509 security token.
The token to be validated.
The identities contained in the token.
token is not assignable from .
token is `null`.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-
There is no issuer name registry (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.IssuerNameRegistry"></xref>) configured.

(The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration.IssuerNameRegistry"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration"></xref> referenced by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenHandler.Configuration"></xref> property is `null`.)
The current <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.X509CertificateValidator"></xref> was unable to validate the certificate in the token.
The current <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.IssuerNameRegistry"></xref> returned `null` when trying to resolve the issuer of the certificate in the token.
Serializes the specified key identifier clause to the XML writer.
The XML writer to which the key identifier clause should be serialized.
The key identifier clause to serialize.
securityKeyIdentifierClause is `null`.
-or-
writer is `null`.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityTokenHandler.WriteXmlDSigDefinedClauseTypes"></xref> property is `false`.
Serializes the specified X.509 security token to the specified XML writer.
The XML writer to which the token should be serialized.
The X.509 security token to serialize.
An instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509SecurityToken"></xref>.
token is `null`.
-or-
writer is `null`.
token is not assignable from .
Gets or Sets the value that specifies whether XmlDsig-defined clause types are preferred.
Supported XmlDSig-defined <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause> types are:
X509IssuerSerial
X509SKI
X509Certificate
`true` if XmlDsig-defined clause types are preferred; otherwise, `false`.

Gets or sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.X509NTAuthChainTrustValidator"></xref> that is used by the current instance during certificate validation when the incoming X.509 certificate is mapped to a Windows account.
An X.509 certificate validator that will validate a specified X.509 certificate and verify whether the certificate can be mapped to a Windows account and whether the certificate chain is trusted.
